description: Numbers n such that n = k/d(k) has exactly 3 solutions, where d(k) = number of divisors of k.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: There are exactly 3 numbers k, 9, 18 and 24, with k/d(k) = 3.
mathematica: (Select[Table[k / Length @ Divisors[k], {k, 1, 200000}], IntegerQ] // Sort // Split // Select[#, Length[#] == 3 &] &)[[All, 1]][[1 ;; 53]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Apr 22 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _R. K. Guy_, _David W. Wilson_
